query.1866:
SELECT * WHERE {
?comm1 p:P31/ps:P31/wdt:P279* wd:Q55488 ; wdt:P17 wd:Q145 ; wdt:P625 ?coord1 ; wdt:P197 ?comm2 .
MINUS { ?comm1 p:P31 [ ps:P31 wd:Q55488 ; pq:P582 [] ] } .
MINUS { ?comm2 p:P31 [ ps:P31 wd:Q55488 ; pq:P582 [] ] } .
MINUS { ?comm1 p:P31 [ ps:P31 wd:Q928830 ] } .
MINUS { ?comm2 p:P31 [ ps:P31 wd:Q928830 ] } .
?comm2 wdt:P625 ?coord2 .
?comm1 p:P625 [ ps:P625 []; psv:P625 [ wikibase:geoLongitude ?coord1lon; wikibase:geoLatitude ?coord1lat; ] ] .
?comm2 p:P625 [ ps:P625 []; psv:P625 [ wikibase:geoLongitude ?coord2lon; wikibase:geoLatitude ?coord2lat; ] ] .
BIND(CONCAT('LINESTRING (', STR(?coord1lon), ' ', STR(?coord1lat), ',', STR(?coord2lon), ' ', STR(?coord2lat), ')') AS ?str) .
BIND(STRDT(?str, geo:wktLiteral) AS ?line) .
}
query.1873:
SELECT ?q1 ?q2 ?label ?coord1 ?coord2 ?dist ?layer ?line WHERE {
?q1 wdt:P31 wd:Q484170 ; rdfs:label ?label ; wdt:P625 ?coord1 . FILTER (lang(?label) = "fr").
?q1 p:P625/psv:P625 ?valuenode1. ?valuenode1 wikibase:geoLatitude ?lat1 . ?valuenode1 wikibase:geoLongitude ?lon1.
?q2 wdt:P31 wd:Q484170 ; rdfs:label ?label ; wdt:P625 ?coord2 . FILTER (lang(?label) = "fr").
?q2 p:P625/psv:P625 ?valuenode2. ?valuenode2 wikibase:geoLatitude ?lat2 . ?valuenode2 wikibase:geoLongitude ?lon2.
FILTER ( str(?q1) > str(?q2) )
BIND(geof:distance(?coord1, ?coord2) AS ?dist).
BIND(floor(?dist/100) AS ?layer).
BIND(CONCAT('LINESTRING (', STR(?lon1), ' ', STR(?lat1), ',', STR(?lon2), ' ', STR(?lat2), ')') AS ?str) .
BIND(STRDT(?str, geo:wktLiteral) AS ?line)
FILTER ( ?dist > 100 )
}
LIMIT 100
query.1886:
SELECT
?char
?charName
(GROUP_CONCAT(DISTINCT ?occupationLabel; SEPARATOR = ",") AS ?arrOccupations)
WHERE {
?char wdt:P1080 wd:Q18043309; # "from narrative universe" "Start Trek multiverse"
wdt:P1080 ?universe; #"from narrative universe"
wdt:P31 wd:Q15632617; # "instance of" "fictional human"
wdt:P106 wd:Q87265645; # occupation "spaceship captain"
wdt:P106 ?occupation.
SERVICE wikibase:label {
bd:serviceParam wikibase:language "[AUTO_LANGUAGE],en".
?char rdfs:label ?charName.
?universe rdfs:label ?universeLabel.
?type rdfs:label ?typeLabel.
?country_of_citizenship rdfs:label ?country_of_citizenshipLabel.
?place_of_birth rdfs:label ?place_of_birthLabel.
?occupation rdfs:label ?occupationLabel.
}
}
GROUP BY ?char ?charName ?arrOccupations
query.1920:
SELECT ?author ?authorLabel ?birthplaceLabel ?idGND ?coord ?country
(GROUP_CONCAT(DISTINCT ?occupation_label; SEPARATOR=", ") as ?occupations) #thanks to @NavinoEvans for this!
WHERE {
?author wdt:P227 ?idGND . #has a GND id
?author wdt:P21 wd:Q6581072 . #is female
?author wdt:P106 wd:Q36180 . #is writer
?author wdt:P19 ?birthplace . # born in a place...
?birthplace wdt:P17 ?country . # which is in a country that is...
?country p:P361/ps:P361 wd:Q12585 . # part of Latin America thanks Tony Bowden! (@tmtm)
?birthplace wdt:P625 ?coord .
OPTIONAL {
?author wdt:P106 ?occupation . #get occupation
?occupation rdfs:label ?occupation_label FILTER (lang(?occupation_label) = "en") #get label the 'manual' way
}
SERVICE wikibase:label { bd:serviceParam wikibase:language "[AUTO_LANGUAGE],en". }
} GROUP BY ?author ?authorLabel ?birthplaceLabel ?idGND ?coord ?country #GROUP BY
LIMIT 5000
query.1929:
SELECT (uri(replace(str(?l), "L", "Q")) as ?item) (MD5(CONCAT(str(?item),str(RAND()))) as ?random) ?l ?hitza ?sense ?ahotsak ?elhuyar ?audio (SAMPLE(?picture_) AS ?picture) WHERE
{
?l a ontolex:LexicalEntry ; dct:language ?language ; wikibase:lemma ?hitza ; ontolex:sense ?esanahia.
?esanahia skos:definition ?sense; wdt:P5137 ?q_concept.
?q_concept wdt:P18 ?picture_.
?language wdt:P218 'eu'.
FILTER (LANG(?sense) = 'eu')
OPTIONAL {?l wdt:P7559 ?ahotsak.}
OPTIONAL {?l wdt:P6838 ?elhuyar.}
?l ontolex:lexicalForm ?f .
?f ontolex:representation ?form ; wdt:P443 ?audio .
filter (regex(str(?f), "-F1$")) .
# Exclude out of scope concepts
MINUS {?q_concept wdt:P31 wd:Q3624078.}. # countries
MINUS {?l wdt:P31 wd:Q1499602.}. #ad hoc hitzak
# Exclude non suitable concepts
VALUES ?minus {
wd:Q47092 # rape
wd:Q198 # war
wd:Q124490 # violence
wd:Q170382 # revolver
wd:Q1576 #cigar
#... add yours here
}.
MINUS {?sense wdt:P5137 ?minus.}.
# Exclude senses not suitable for young children:
MINUS {
VALUES ?filter { wd:Q8102 wd:Q545779 wd:Q1521634 wd:Q571571 wd:Q184439 }
?esanahia wdt:P6191 ?filter.
}
}
GROUP BY ?l ?sense ?hitza ?ahotsak ?elhuyar ?audio
ORDER BY ?random
LIMIT 1
query.1933:
SELECT DISTINCT ?cd ?l ?i ?iLabel ?ct ?ctLabel ?rgb ?x WITH{SELECT ?i ?cd ?lat1 ?lon1 ?loc ?x(sample(?op)as?op)WHERE{VALUES ?c1{wd:Q668 wd:Q843 wd:Q902}?i wdt:P31/wdt:P279* wd:Q55488;wdt:P625 ?cd;wdt:P17 ?c1;p:P625/psv:P625 ?y.?y wikibase:geoLatitude ?lat1;wikibase:geoLongitude ?lon1.MINUS{?i wdt:P31/wdt:P279* wd:Q928830}OPTIONAL{?i wdt:P131 ?loc}OPTIONAL{?i wdt:P137 ?op}OPTIONAL{{?i wdt:P5696 ?x}UNION{?i wdt:P6785 ?x}}OPTIONAL{?i wdt:P17 wd:Q902. BIND("-"as?x)}}GROUP BY ?i ?cd ?lat1 ?lon1 ?loc ?x}AS%s
WITH{SELECT ?l ?ct ?o ?t WHERE{INCLUDE %s.?i p:P197 ?nss.?nss ps:P197 ?ns.?ns p:P625/psv:P625 ?z.?z wikibase:geoLatitude ?lat2;wikibase:geoLongitude ?lon2.OPTIONAL{?nss pq:P81 ?ct.OPTIONAL{?ct wdt:P127 ?o}}OPTIONAL{?nss pq:P5051 ?t}FILTER(STR(?i)< STR(?ns)).BIND(CONCAT('LINESTRING(',STR(?lon1),' ',STR(?lat1),',',STR(?lon2),' ',STR(?lat2),')')AS?str).BIND(STRDT(?str,geo:wktLiteral)AS?l)}}AS%l
WHERE{{INCLUDE%s}UNION{INCLUDE%l}.BIND(IF(BOUND(?l),IF(BOUND(?ct),IF(BOUND(?t),IF(BOUND(?o),"00f","4682b4"),"40e0d0"),"0f0"),IF(BOUND(?x),IF(BOUND(?loc),IF(BOUND(?op),"00f","4682b4"),"40e0d0"),"0f0"))AS?rgb)SERVICE wikibase:label{bd:serviceParam wikibase:language "en".}}#
query.1934:
SELECT DISTINCT ?countryLabel ?hgovernmentLabel ?gage ?hstateLabel ?sage WHERE {
?country wdt:P31 wd:Q3624078.
FILTER(NOT EXISTS { ?country wdt:P31 wd:Q3024240. })
?country p:P6 ?statement.
?statement ps:P6 ?hgovernment.
?country wdt:P6 ?hgovernment.
FILTER(NOT EXISTS { ?statement pq:P582 ?x. })
?country p:P35 ?sstatement.
?sstatement ps:P35 ?hstate.
?country wdt:P35 ?hstate.
FILTER(NOT EXISTS { ?statement pq:P582 ?x. })
?hgovernment wdt:P569 ?dobh.
BIND((YEAR(NOW())) - (YEAR(?dobh)) AS ?gage)
?hstate wdt:P569 ?dobs.
BIND((YEAR(NOW())) - (YEAR(?dobs)) AS ?sage)
SERVICE wikibase:label { bd:serviceParam wikibase:language "en". }
}
ORDER BY (?countryLabel)
query.1935:
SELECT DISTINCT ?city ?cityLabel ?county ?countyLabel ?state ?stateLabel ?pop ?coord
WHERE
{
?city wdt:P31 wd:Q1093829 .
?city wdt:P1082 ?pop .
FILTER (?pop >= 100000 && ?pop <= 600000)
?city wdt:P131 ?county .
?county wdt:P31/wdt:P279 wd:Q47168 .
?county wdt:P131 ?state .
?state wdt:P31 wd:Q35657 .
?city wdt:P625 ?coord .
SERVICE wikibase:label { bd:serviceParam wikibase:language "[AUTO_LANGUAGE],en". }
} ORDER BY ?stateLabel ?countyLabel ?cityLabel
query.1936:
SELECT DISTINCT ?person ?personLabel ?office ?officeLabel ?end1 ?start2 (FLOOR(?days/36.525)/10 AS ?gap)
WHERE {
# Offices Held by Heads of Government
?country wdt:P31 wd:Q3624078; p:P1313/ps:P1313 ?office .
# People who have held the office more than once
?person p:P39 [ ps:P39 ?office ; pq:P582 ?end1 ] .
?person p:P39 [ ps:P39 ?office ; pq:P580 ?start2 ] .
FILTER (?start2 > ?end1)
FILTER NOT EXISTS { # but must be successive periods
?person p:P39 [ ps:P39 ?office ; pq:P580 ?start3 ] .
FILTER((?start3 > ?end1) && (?start3 < ?start2))
}
# How long between end of one term and start of the next
BIND (?start2 - ?end1 AS ?days)
SERVICE wikibase:label { bd:serviceParam wikibase:language "[AUTO_LANGUAGE],en". }
}
ORDER BY DESC(?days)
LIMIT 10
query.1943:
SELECT DISTINCT ?item ?itemLabel ?koord ?layer WHERE {
wd:Q191045 ((wdt:P22|wdt:P25)*) ?item.
?item wdt:P19 ?place.
?place wdt:P625 ?koord.
?item wdt:P21 ?sex.
BIND (IF(?sex = wd:Q6581097, "gizonezkoa",
IF(?sex = wd:Q6581072, "emakumezkoa",
"")) AS ?layer)
SERVICE wikibase:label { bd:serviceParam wikibase:language "eu,en,fr,pl,es". }
}
ORDER BY (?itemLabel)
query.1954: select ?item ?itemLabel ?sexeLabel ?cocLabel (concat("https://www.facebook.com/",?fbc) as ?facebook) (concat('https://www.twitter.com/',?twc) as ?twitter) (concat('https://www.instagram.com/',?inc,'/') as ?insta){ { select distinct ?item where { ?item wdt:P106 wd:Q937857 . ?item wdt:P21 wd:Q6581072 . {?item wdt:P2013 ?fb} union {?item wdt:P2002 ?tw} union {?item wdt:P2003 ?in} } } optional {?item wdt:P2013 ?fbc} optional {?item wdt:P2002 ?twc} optional {?item wdt:P2003 ?inc} optional {?item wdt:P21 ?sexe} optional {?item wdt:P27 ?coc} SERVICE wikibase:label { bd:serviceParam wikibase:language "nl,en" }}
query.1962:
SELECT ?item ?itemLabel ?age ?end_causeLabel ?end_time ?dob WHERE {
?item wdt:P569 ?dob .
?item p:P39 ?mp_stmt .
?mp_stmt ps:P39 ?mp .
?mp_stmt pq:P582 ?end_time .
OPTIONAL {
VALUES ?excluded_cause {wd:Q1787171 wd:Q35855188 wd:Q30580660 wd:Q35867887 wd:Q52084147} .
?mp_stmt pq:P1534 ?excluded_cause .
}
FILTER(!bound(?excluded_cause)) .
?mp_stmt pq:P1534 ?end_cause .
?mp wdt:P279 wd:Q16707842 .
?mp_next_parl wdt:P155 ?mp .
MINUS {?item wdt:P39 ?mp_next_parl} .
BIND (((?end_time - ?dob) / 365.24) AS ?age) .
FILTER(bound(?age)) .
FILTER(year(?end_time) > 1899) .
SERVICE wikibase:label { bd:serviceParam wikibase:language "[AUTO_LANGUAGE],en". }
} ORDER BY ?age
LIMIT 200
query.1968:
SELECT ?depth ?out ?predecessor ?outLabel ?predecessorLabel {SERVICE gas:service{gas:program gas:gasClass "com.bigdata.rdf.graph.analytics.BFS";
gas:in wd:Q23;gas:target wd:Q3044;gas:out ?out;gas:out1 ?depth;gas:out2 ?predecessor;gas:linkType wdt:P40;gas:traversalDirection "Reverse".}.SERVICE wikibase:label { bd:serviceParam wikibase:language "[AUTO_LANGUAGE],en". }}ORDER BY DESC(?depth)
query.1971:
SELECT ?itemLabel (ROUND(AVG(?age)) AS ?avg)
WHERE
{
?item wdt:P31 wd:Q223371.
?item wdt:P17 ?country.
?item wdt:P527 ?components.
?components wdt:P571 ?founding.
bind( year(now())-year(?founding) as ?age )
SERVICE wikibase:label { bd:serviceParam wikibase:language "[AUTO_LANGUAGE],en" }
}
GROUP BY ?itemLabel
ORDER BY ?avg
query.1977:
SELECT ?item ?itemLabel ?coords ?layer
WHERE
{
?item wdt:P39 wd:Q842606.
?item wdt:P20 ?PoD.
?PoD wdt:P625 ?coords .
?item rdfs:label ?itemLabel . filter(lang(?itemLabel)="en")
optional { ?item wdt:P1196 ?manner.
?manner rdfs:label ?mannerLabel . filter(lang(?mannerLabel)="en")
bind(?mannerLabel as ?layer) }
}
query.1979:
SELECT DISTINCT ?item ?dob ?sign {
?item wdt:P31 wd:Q5 ; p:P39/ps:P39/wdt:P279* wd:Q274948 . # all Japanese Prime Ministers
?item p:P569/psv:P569 [ # with a known birthday
wikibase:timeValue ?dob; wikibase:timePrecision 11 # of "day" precision
].
BIND(MONTH(?dob)AS ?month)
BIND(DAY(?dob)AS ?day)
BIND(IF(((?month=3)&&(?day>=21))||((?month=4)&&(?day<20)),"Aries",
IF(((?month=4)&&(?day>=20))||((?month=5)&&(?day<21)),"Taurus",
IF(((?month=5)&&(?day>=21))||((?month=6)&&(?day<21)),"Gemini",
IF(((?month=6)&&(?day>=21))||((?month=7)&&(?day<23)),"Cancer",
IF(((?month=7)&&(?day>=23))||((?month=8)&&(?day<23)),"Leo",
IF(((?month=8)&&(?day>=23))||((?month=9)&&(?day<23)),"Virgo",
IF(((?month=9)&&(?day>=23))||((?month=10)&&(?day<23)),"Libra",
IF(((?month=10)&&(?day>=23))||((?month=11)&&(?day<22)),"Scorpio",
IF(((?month=11)&&(?day>=23))||((?month=12)&&(?day<22)),"Sagittarius",
IF(((?month=12)&&(?day>=22))||((?month=1)&&(?day<20)),"Capricorn",
IF(((?month=1)&&(?day>=20))||((?month=2)&&(?day<19)),"Aquarius",
IF(((?month=2)&&(?day>=19))||((?month=3)&&(?day<21)),"Pisces",
"unknown (this should never happen)"
))))))))))))
AS ?sign)
SERVICE wikibase:label { bd:serviceParam wikibase:language 'en' }
}
query.1993:
SELECT ?geo ?layer WHERE {
?ereserki wdt:P31 wd:Q23691 ; wdt:P17 ?country ; wdt:P826 ?ton .
?country wdt:P3896 ?geo .
?ton rdfs:label ?tonLabel .
FILTER (lang(?tonLabel) = "eu").
BIND ( ?tonLabel AS ?layer )
}
query.1994:
SELECT ?item1 ?item1Label ?item2Label ?item3Label ?item4Label ?item5Label ?item6Label WHERE {
?item1 wdt:P138 ?item2 .
?item2 wdt:P138 ?item3 .
?item3 wdt:P138 ?item4 .
?item4 wdt:P138 ?item5 .
?item5 wdt:P138 ?item6 .
FILTER (?item1 != ?item2 && ?item2 != ?item3 && ?item3 != ?item4 && ?item4 != ?item5 && ?item5 != ?item6) .
FILTER (?item1 != ?item3 && ?item2 != ?item4 && ?item3 != ?item5 && ?item4 != ?item6) .
FILTER (?item1 != ?item4 && ?item2 != ?item5 && ?item3 != ?item6) .
FILTER (?item1 != ?item5 && ?item2 != ?item6) .
FILTER (?item1 != ?item6) .
SERVICE wikibase:label { bd:serviceParam wikibase:language "[AUTO_LANGUAGE],en,de,fr". }
}
query.2006:
SELECT ?month ?year (count(*) as ?count) WHERE {
?item wdt:P31 wd:Q5.
?item (p:P570/psv:P570) ?timenode0.
?timenode0 wikibase:timeValue ?time0.
?timenode0 wikibase:timePrecision ?timeprecision0.
FILTER('2019-01-01'^^xsd:dateTime <= ?time0 && ?time0 < '2021-12-31'^^xsd:dateTime).
FILTER(?timeprecision0>=8)
?item wdt:P570 ?time.
?item wdt:P509 wd:Q84263196.
bind(month(?time0) as ?month)
bind(year(?time0) as ?year)
}
group by ?month ?year
query.2024:
select (str(?decade) as ?dec) (count(distinct ?ps) as ?count) ?causeLabel where
{
?mp p:P39 ?ps . ?ps ps:P39 ?term . ?term wdt:P279 wd:Q16707842 .
?ps pq:P582 ?pend . filter not exists { ?mp p:P39 ?ps2 . ?ps2 ps:P39 ?term . ?ps2 pq:P580 ?pend }
# not new term starting same day - ie left Parliament
?ps pq:P1534 ?cause .
filter not exists { ?ps pq:P1534 wd:Q741182 } # not dissolution
filter not exists { ?ps pq:P1534 wd:Q7649223 } # not suspension
filter not exists { ?ps pq:P1534 wd:Q35855188 } # tofix
filter not exists { ?ps pq:P1534 wd:Q36345696 } # tofix
filter not exists { ?ps pq:P1534 wd:Q30580660 } # tofix
filter not exists { ?ps pq:P1534 wd:Q52084147 } # tofix
filter not exists { ?ps pq:P1534 wd:Q35867887 } # tofix
bind(year(?pend) as ?year) . filter(?year >= 1880) . bind((floor(?year/10)*10) as ?decade) .
SERVICE wikibase:label { bd:serviceParam wikibase:language "[AUTO_LANGUAGE],en". }
} group by ?causeLabel ?decade order by ?causeLabel
#defaultView:BarChart
query.2031:
SELECT distinct ?itemLabel ?date ?sourcePropertyLabel ?referenceLabel ?reference
WHERE
{
?item wdt:P39/wdt:P279 wd:Q1285463.
?item p:P569 ?dateStatement.
?dateStatement a wikibase:BestRank; # simulate wdt:
ps:P569 ?date.
OPTIONAL{
?dateStatement prov:wasDerivedFrom [ ?source ?reference ].
?sourceProperty wikibase:reference ?source.
}
?item p:P39 ?decla.
?decla pq:P580 ?ddebut.
FILTER NOT EXISTS {?decla pq:P582 ?dfin. }
FILTER (?date > "1952-01-01T00:00:00+00:00"^^xsd:dateTime)
SERVICE wikibase:label { bd:serviceParam wikibase:language "[AUTO_LANGUAGE],fr". }.
}
query.2039:
SELECT DISTINCT ?gizaki ?gizakiLabel ?jaiolekuaLabel ?heriotzalekuaLabel ?year ?layer ?data (CONCAT(STR(?year), "-01-01 00:00:00") as ?concat) ?lat ?lon ?lat2 ?lon2 WHERE {
SERVICE wikibase:label { bd:serviceParam wikibase:language "[AUTO_LANGUAGE],en". }
?gizaki wdt:P31 wd:Q5;
(wdt:P19/(wdt:P131*)/^wdt:P527) wd:Q47588.
?gizaki wdt:P19 ?jaiolekua.
?jaiolekua p:P625 ?koordenatuak.
?koordenatuak psv:P625 ?koord.
?koord wikibase:geoLatitude ?lat.
?koord wikibase:geoLongitude ?lon.
?gizaki wdt:P570 ?data.
BIND(YEAR(?data) as ?year).
BIND(FLOOR((?year-1)/100)+1 AS ?mende).
BIND(?mende as ?layer)
?gizaki wdt:P20 ?heriotzalekua.
?heriotzalekua p:P625 ?koordenatuak2.
?koordenatuak2 psv:P625 ?koord2.
?koord2 wikibase:geoLatitude ?lat2.
?koord2 wikibase:geoLongitude ?lon2.
}
query.2046:
SELECT ?decade
(100*SUM(?tuberculosiscount)/COUNT(?decade) AS ?percentage_of_deaths_cause_by_tuberculosis)
WHERE
{
?item wdt:P509 ?causeofdeath.
?item wdt:P570 ?sterbedatum.
BIND(CONCAT(SUBSTR(CONCAT(STR(YEAR(?sterbedatum))),0,4),"0") as ?decade).
FILTER( ?sterbedatum >= "1750-01-01T00:00:00"^^xsd:dateTime )
FILTER( ?sterbedatum <= "2019-12-31T00:00:00"^^xsd:dateTime )
BIND(
IF(?causeofdeath = wd:Q12204,1,0)
AS ?tuberculosiscount).
}
GROUP BY ?decade #?ref
ORDER BY ?decade
query.2054:
SELECT DISTINCT ?item ?itemLabel ?rgb ?link ?link2
WHERE
{
VALUES ?toggle { true false }
?disease wdt:P699 ?doid;
wdt:P279* wd:Q18123741;
wdt:P2176 ?drug.
?drug wdt:P3780 ?active.
?drug rdfs:label ?drugLabel.
FILTER(LANG(?drugLabel) = "en").
?disease rdfs:label ?diseaseLabel.
FILTER(LANG(?diseaseLabel) = "eu").
BIND(IF(?toggle,?disease,?drug) AS ?item).
BIND(IF(?toggle,?diseaseLabel,?drugLabel) AS ?itemLabel).
BIND(IF(?toggle,"FFA500","7FFF00") AS ?rgb).
BIND(IF(?toggle,"",?disease) AS ?link).
}
query.2056:
SELECT ?name ?nameLabel ?dod ?image (GROUP_CONCAT(DISTINCT ?occupationLabel;separator=", ") AS ?occupations) (GROUP_CONCAT(DISTINCT ?countryLabel;separator=", ") AS ?countries) WHERE {
?name wdt:P27 wd:Q31 .
?name wdt:P27 ?country .
?name wdt:P570 ?dod .
?name wdt:P106/wdt:P279* wd:Q483501 .
?name wdt:P106 ?occupation .
OPTIONAL {?name wdt:P18 ?image} .
FILTER (YEAR(?dod) = 1950) .
SERVICE wikibase:label { bd:serviceParam wikibase:language "[AUTO_LANGUAGE],en".
?occupation rdfs:label ?occupationLabel .
?country rdfs:label ?countryLabel .
?name rdfs:label ?nameLabel .}
}
GROUP BY ?name ?dod ?image ?nameLabel
query.2060:
SELECT
?year
(SUM(?pages_per_author) AS ?number_of_pages)
?researcher_label
WHERE {
{
SELECT
?researcher_label ?work ?year
(SAMPLE(?pages) / COUNT(?researcher_of_paper) AS ?pages_per_author)
WHERE {
# Find authors associated with organization
FILTER EXISTS { ?researcher wdt:P108 | wdt:P463 | (wdt:P1416 / wdt:P361*) wd:Q27639076 . }
?work (wdt:P50|wdt:P2093) ?researcher_of_paper .
# Disabled to only look on scholarly articles
# ?work wdt:P31 wd:Q13442814 .
?work wdt:P50 ?researcher .
?work wdt:P1104 ?pages .
?work wdt:P577 ?date .
BIND(STR(YEAR(?date)) AS ?year)
?researcher rdfs:label ?researcher_label . FILTER(LANG(?researcher_label) = 'en')
}
GROUP BY ?work ?researcher_label ?year
}
}
GROUP BY ?year ?researcher_label
ORDER BY ?year
query.2061:
SELECT DISTINCT ?item ?itemLabel ?accusedurl ?coords ?residenceLabel ?image (?ritual as ?layer)
WHERE
{
?item wdt:P31 wd:Q5.
?item wdt:P4478 ?accused .
wd:P4478 wdt:P1630 ?formatterurl .
BIND(IRI(REPLACE(?accused, '^(.+)$', ?formatterurl)) AS ?accusedurl).
?item wdt:P551 ?residence .
?residence wdt:P625 ?coords.
?item wdt:P8706 ?RitualObject .
OPTIONAL { ?RitualObject wdt:P18 ?image }
SERVICE wikibase:label { bd:serviceParam wikibase:language "[AUTO_LANGUAGE],en".
?charge rdfs:label ?chargeLabel .
?RitualObject rdfs:label ?ritual .
?residence rdfs:label ?residenceLabel .
?item rdfs:label ?itemLabel .
?accused rdfs:label ?accusedLabel .}
}
query.2070:
SELECT ?metro ?metroLabel ?locationLabel ?clientelaLabel
WHERE {
?metro wdt:P31 wd:Q5503.
?metro wdt:P131 ?location .
?metro wdt:P3872 ?clientela .
SERVICE wikibase:label { bd:serviceParam wikibase:language "es,en". } }
order by ?clientela
limit 200
query.2073:
SELECT DISTINCT ?item ?itemLabel ?url ?georeferencing ?img ?bbox ?rgb (year(?year) AS ?layer)
WITH {
SELECT (xsd:integer(?colour) AS ?colour2) ?rgb WHERE {
wd:Q105849312 p:P527 ?stmt .
?stmt pq:P1545 ?colour .
?stmt pq:P465 ?rgb .
}
} AS %colours
WHERE {
?item wdt:P195 wd:Q7100888 . # OSD
?item p:P1332/psv:P1332/wikibase:geoLatitude ?nth .
?item p:P1333/psv:P1333/wikibase:geoLatitude ?sth .
?item p:P1334/psv:P1334/wikibase:geoLongitude ?east .
?item p:P1335/psv:P1335/wikibase:geoLongitude ?west .
?item wdt:P571 ?year .
BIND ((1 + floor ((year(?year) - 1789) * 2.0/3.0)) AS ?colour) .
BIND (xsd:integer(IF(?colour > 31, 31, ?colour)) AS ?colour2) .
INCLUDE %colours .

}

query.2078:
SELECT
?article
(SUM(?male) AS ?count_males)
(SUM(?female) AS ?count_females)
(SUM(?nonbinary) AS ?count_nonbinary)
(COUNT(*) AS ?count)
(ROUND(100 * ?count_females / (?count_females + ?count_males + ?count_nonbinary)) AS ?share_females)
(ROUND(100 * ?count_nonbinary / (?count_females + ?count_males + ?count_nonbinary)) AS ?share_nonbinary)
(ROUND(100 * ?count_males / (?count_females + ?count_males + ?count_nonbinary)) AS ?share_males)
{
VALUES ?article {
"Anthropology"
"Philosophy"
"Economics"
"Sociology"
"Demography"
}
SERVICE wikibase:mwapi {
bd:serviceParam wikibase:endpoint "en.wikipedia.org";
wikibase:api "Generator";
mwapi:generator "links";
mwapi:titles ?article;.
?item wikibase:apiOutputItem mwapi:item.
}
FILTER BOUND (?item)
?item wdt:P31 wd:Q5 .
?item wdt:P21 ?gender .
BIND(IF(?gender IN(wd:Q6581097, wd:Q2449503), 1, 0) AS ?male )
BIND(IF(?gender IN(wd:Q6581072, wd:Q1052281), 1, 0 ) AS ?female)
BIND(IF(?gender = wd:Q48270, 1, 0) AS ?nonbinary)
}
GROUP BY ?article
query.2081:
SELECT ?x ?xLabel ?description ?x_coords ?rgb WITH {
SELECT ?data ?x ?x_coords WHERE {
?x p:P2044/psn:P2044 [
wikibase:quantityAmount ?data
] .
?x wdt:P625 ?x_coords .
?x wdt:P17 wd:Q34 .
# ?x wdt:P131+ [ wdt:P31 wd:Q15979307 ] .
}
} AS %data
# determine the max and min values (used to calculate the spread)
WITH {
SELECT (MAX(?data) AS ?max_data) (MIN(?data) AS ?min_data) WHERE {
INCLUDE %data
}} AS %min_max
WHERE {
INCLUDE %data
INCLUDE %min_max
?x rdfs:label ?xLabel. FILTER (LANG(?xLabel) = "sv") .
BIND (CONCAT("Hojd over havsnivan for ", ?xLabel, " ar omkring ", STR(ROUND(?data)), " meter" ) AS ?description)
BIND ( ?max_data - ?min_data AS ?spread )
BIND (255 - xsd:integer( 255 * (?data - ?min_data) / ?spread) AS ?green ) # 255 -> 0
BIND ( FLOOR (?green / 16) AS ?green_1 )
BIND ( COALESCE(
IF(?green_1 < 10, STR(?green_1), 1/0),
IF(?green_1 = 10, "a", 1/0),
IF(?green_1 = 11, "b", 1/0),
IF(?green_1 = 12, "c", 1/0),
IF(?green_1 = 13, "d", 1/0),
IF(?green_1 = 14, "e", 1/0),
IF(?green_1 = 15, "f", 1/0),
"ERROR"
) AS ?green_hex1 )
BIND (FLOOR(?green - (16 * xsd:integer( ?green / 16 ))) AS ?green_2)
BIND ( COALESCE(
IF(?green_2 < 10, STR(?green_2), 1/0),
IF(?green_2 = 10, "a", 1/0),
IF(?green_2 = 11, "b", 1/0),
IF(?green_2 = 12, "c", 1/0),
IF(?green_2 = 13, "d", 1/0),
IF(?green_2 = 14, "e", 1/0),
IF(?green_2 = 15, "f", 1/0),
"ERROR"
) AS ?green_hex2 )
BIND (CONCAT(STR(?green_hex1), STR(?green_hex2)) AS ?green_hex )
BIND (CONCAT("00", STR(?green_hex), "00") AS ?rgb)
}

?region p:P31 ?stat.

?stat ps:P31/wdt:P279* wd:Q10864048.
# ?region wdt:P31/wdt:P279* wd:Q10864048.
#UNION { ?city wdt:P31/wdt:P279* wd:Q515. }
?region wdt:P1082 ?pop.
?region wdt:P150 ?regionContained.
# only in Germany
?region wdt:P17 wd:Q183.
MINUS { ?region wdt:P576 ?x. } # remove region that has been disolved
# remove region that is nowdays not a first level administrative region
SERVICE wikibase:label { bd:serviceParam wikibase:language "en" }
}

?Orga p:P8093 ?Spenden_statement . # Statement Spenden
?Spenden_statement psv:P8093 ?Spenden_Wert . # Wert Spenden
?Spenden_Wert wikibase:quantityAmount ?Spenden . # Summe Spenden
?Spenden_statement pq:P585 ?Spenden_Zeit . # Zeitpunk Spenden

{

}

SELECT ?place ?placeLabel ?location (GROUP_CONCAT(?typeLabel_;separator="; ") as ?typeLabel) WHERE {
hint:Query hint:optimizer "None".
VALUES ?island {wd:Q1552121}
?island wdt:P5140 ?point .
SERVICE wikibase:around {
?place wdt:P625 ?location .
bd:serviceParam wikibase:center ?point .
bd:serviceParam wikibase:radius "10" .
}
?place p:P625/psv:P625/wikibase:geoLatitude ?lat .
?place p:P625/psv:P625/wikibase:geoLongitude ?long .
?island p:P1332/psv:P1332/wikibase:geoLatitude ?north .
?island p:P1333/psv:P1333/wikibase:geoLatitude ?south .
?island p:P1334/psv:P1334/wikibase:geoLongitude ?east .
?island p:P1335/psv:P1335/wikibase:geoLongitude ?west .
FILTER ( ?lat <= ?north )
FILTER ( ?lat >= ?south )
FILTER ( ?long <= ?east )
FILTER ( ?long >= ?west )
OPTIONAL { ?place wdt:P31 ?type . }
SERVICE wikibase:label { bd:serviceParam wikibase:language "en" .
?place rdfs:label ?placeLabel .
?type rdfs:label ?typeLabel_ .}
} group by ?place ?placeLabel ?location

SELECT DISTINCT
(COUNT(?author2) as ?n_paper)
(SAMPLE(?article_2) as ?sample)
(SAMPLE(?article_2Label)as ?sampleLabel)
?author2Label ?author2
WHERE
{
?article_1 wdt:P50 wd:Q46168094 .
?article_1 wdt:P50 ?author1 .
?article_2 wdt:P50 ?author1 .
?article_2 wdt:P50 ?author2 .
MINUS{
?article_3 wdt:P50 wd:Q46168094 .
?article_3 wdt:P50 ?author2 . }
?article_2 rdfs:label ?article_2Label .
FILTER(lang(?article_2Label)="en")
?article_1 wdt:P577 ?publication_date1 .
?article_2 wdt:P577 ?publication_date2 .

FILTER(year(?publication_date2) > 2015)

?distribution ?distributionLabel ?distributionDescription
?img
(COUNT(*) AS ?count)
(GROUP_CONCAT(DISTINCT CONCAT(?t," (",str(YEAR(?d)),")"); separator="; ") as ?titles)
(MIN(YEAR(?d)) as ?from)
(MAX(YEAR(?d)) as ?to)

{
?item wdt:P161 wd:Q106255, ?distribution.

?item wdt:P1476 ?t .

SELECT ?sitelink ?site ?title ?taille
WHERE
{
?sitelink schema:about wd:Q1290.
?sitelink schema:isPartOf ?site.
?sitelink schema:isPartOf/wikibase:wikiGroup "wikipedia" .
?sitelink schema:name ?title.
BIND (STRBEFORE(STRAFTER(STR(?site), "https://"), "/") AS ?endpoint)
BIND (STR(?title) AS ?title_nolang)
SERVICE wikibase:mwapi
{
bd:serviceParam wikibase:endpoint ?endpoint.
bd:serviceParam wikibase:api "Generator".
bd:serviceParam mwapi:generator "revisions".
bd:serviceParam mwapi:titles ?title_nolang.
bd:serviceParam mwapi:prop "revisions".
bd:serviceParam mwapi:rvprop "size".
?size wikibase:apiOutput "revisions/rev[last()]/@size".
}
BIND ( xsd:integer(?size) AS ?taille )
}
ORDER BY DESC(?taille)
query.2402:
SELECT ?weekday (count(distinct(?item)) as ?count) WHERE {
wd:Q362 wdt:P580 ?od ; wdt:P582 ?do.
?item wdt:P20 wd:Q160139 .
?item p:P570 [ps:P570 ?date ; psv:P570/wikibase:timePrecision ?precision ] filter(?precision = 11 && day(?date) != 1 && ?date > ?od && ?date < ?do ).
BIND( DAY( ?date ) AS ?q ) .
BIND( MONTH( ?date ) + IF( MONTH( ?date ) < 3, 12, 0 ) AS ?m ) .
BIND( YEAR( ?date ) - IF( MONTH( ?date ) < 3, 1, 0 ) AS ?_year ) .
BIND( ?_year - FLOOR( ?_year / 100 ) * 100 AS ?K ) . # modulo
BIND( FLOOR( YEAR( ?date ) / 100 ) AS ?J ) .
BIND( ?q + FLOOR( 13 * ( ?m + 1 ) / 5 ) + ?K + FLOOR( ?K / 4 ) + FLOOR( ?J / 4 ) - 2 * ?J AS ?_h ) .
BIND(( ?_h - FLOOR( ?_h / 7 ) * 7) as ?day) .
BIND(if(?day=0,"06 (Saturday)",if(?day=1,"07 (Sunday)",if(?day=2,"01 (Monday)",if(?day=3,"02 (Tuesday)",if(?day=4,"03 (Wednesday)",if(?day=5,"04 (Thursday)",if(?day=6,"05 (Friday)",""))))))) as ?weekday) .
} group by ?weekday order by asc(?weekday)
query.2405:
SELECT (?year_d as ?year) (COUNT(?futbolari)as ?count) WHERE {
SERVICE wikibase:label { bd:serviceParam wikibase:language "[AUTO_LANGUAGE],en". }
?futbolari wdt:P106 wd:Q937857.
?futbolari wdt:P570 ?heriotza_data.
?futbolari wdt:P569 ?jaiotza_data.
BIND (year(?heriotza_data) as ?year_d).
BIND (year(?jaiotza_data) as ?year_j).
BIND (?year_d - ?year_j as ?age).
FILTER (?age < 40)
}
GROUP by ?year_d
query.2408:
SELECT * WHERE {
?place wdt:P31 wd:Q42744322 ; # German municipalities
wdt:P1448 ?name . # their official names
BIND(lcase(?name) as ?lemma) # use the names in lower case as lemma
?lexeme wikibase:lemma ?lemma ; # lexemes with that lemma
wikibase:lexicalCategory wd:Q24905; # verbs
dct:language wd:Q188 # in German
}
query.2415:
SELECT ?item ?itemLabel ?dob ?dod WHERE {
?item (p:P569/psv:P569) _:b44.
_:b44 wikibase:timePrecision 11;
wikibase:timeValue ?dob.
?item (p:P570/psv:P570) _:b45.
_:b45 wikibase:timePrecision 11;
wikibase:timeValue ?dod.
#FILTER(?precisionDob = 11 )
#FILTER(?precisionDod = 11 )
FILTER((DAY(?dob)) = (DAY(?dod)))
FILTER((MONTH(?dob)) = (MONTH(?dod)))
FILTER( ((YEAR(?dod)) - (YEAR(?dob))) = 50)
?item rdfs:label ?itemLabel. FILTER(LANG(?itemLabel)="de")
}
LIMIT 5
query.2426:
SELECT
(GROUP_CONCAT(?occupationLabel; SEPARATOR= ", ") as ?occupations)
?item ?linkcount ?itemLabel
WHERE
{
?item wdt:P27 wd:Q155 .
?item wikibase:sitelinks ?linkcount .
OPTIONAL{
?item wdt:P106 ?occupation .
?occupation rdfs:label ?occupationLabel .
FILTER(LANG(?occupationLabel)="pt") .
} .
?item rdfs:label ?itemLabel .
FILTER(LANG(?itemLabel)="pt") .
}
GROUP BY ?item ?linkcount ?itemLabel
ORDER BY DESC(?linkcount)
LIMIT 100
query.2430:
SELECT ?station ?stationLabel ?subwayLine ?coords ?line ?line_number ?layer ?rgb WHERE {
VALUES ?search { wd:Q1510414 #light rail system search
}
?search wdt:P527|wdt:P121 ?lignes.#what are the lines of that light rail?
?lignes wdt:P559 ?termini.#what are the termini of the lines of that light rail
?station wdt:P31/wdt:P279* wd:Q548662; #any type of service station
wdt:P5817 wd:Q55654238;#That are running
wdt:P16 ?search;#That are part of the searched light rail network
wdt:P625 ?coords;
wdt:P81|wdt:P1192 ?subwayLine;
wdt:P197 ?pred.
?pred wdt:P625 ?coords_pred;wdt:P5817 wd:Q55654238;#Neighbours that are running
wdt:P81|wdt:P1192 ?subwayLine_pred.
?station p:P197 _:b1.
_:b1 ps:P197 ?pred ;
pq:P5051 ?towards;
pq:P81|pq:P1192 ?line_pq.
?subwayLine wdt:P5817 wd:Q55654238.#Lines that are running
optional{?subwayLine wdt:P1671 ?line_number.}
FILTER(?subwayLine_pred = ?lignes)#take only the lines if correspondance on the same line
FILTER(?subwayLine = ?lignes)
FILTER(?subwayLine = ?line_pq)#Take only the lines if next station on the same line
FILTER(?towards = ?termini)
?pred p:P625 ?node_pred .
?node_pred psv:P625/wikibase:geoLatitude ?lat1 ;psv:P625/wikibase:geoLongitude ?lon1 .
?node_pred a wikibase:BestRank.
?station p:P625 ?node_station.
?node_station psv:P625/wikibase:geoLatitude ?lat2 ;psv:P625/wikibase:geoLongitude ?lon2.
?node_station a wikibase:BestRank.
BIND(CONCAT("LINESTRING(", STR(?lon1), " ", STR(?lat1), ",", STR(?lon2), " ", STR(?lat2), ")") AS ?str)
BIND(STRDT(?str, geo:wktLiteral) AS ?line)
?subwayLine wdt:P465 ?rgb.
SERVICE wikibase:label {
bd:serviceParam wikibase:language "[AUTO_LANGUAGE],en" .
?subwayLine rdfs:label ?layer.
?pred rdfs:label ?predLabel.
?station rdfs:label ?stationLabel .
} } GROUP BY ?station ?stationLabel ?subwayLine ?rgb ?predLabel ?layer ?coords ?line ?line_number
ORDER BY xsd:integer(?line_number) ?line_number ?subwayLine
query.2435:
SELECT ?controversies ?controversiesLabel ?sitelinks WHERE {
# find all "controversies" items using CirrusSearch (SPARQL isn't the right tool for this job)
SERVICE wikibase:mwapi {
bd:serviceParam wikibase:endpoint "www.wikidata.org";
wikibase:api "Search";
# note: the "inlabel" keyword also searches aliases
# exclude scholarly articles (Q13442814), there's plenty of them and we don't care about them here
# also exclude categories (Q4167836, P4224); we'll filter them out again below, but excluding some here speeds things up
mwapi:srsearch "inlabel:controversies@en -haswbstatement:P31=Q13442814 -haswbstatement:P31=Q4167836 -haswbstatement:P4224";
# get as many search results at once as possible
mwapi:srlimit "max".
?controversies wikibase:apiOutputItem mwapi:title.
}
# get the number of sitelinks and the English label
?controversies wikibase:sitelinks ?sitelinks;
rdfs:label ?controversiesLabel.
FILTER(LANG(?controversiesLabel) = "en")
# filter out categories (-haswbstatement:P31=Q4167836 doesn't exclude categories that are instance of a subclass of Q4167836)
FILTER(!STRSTARTS(?controversiesLabel, "Category:"@en))
# also filter out templates (only one match at the moment, not worth adding this to the search string)
FILTER(!STRSTARTS(?controversiesLabel, "Template:"@en))
# filter out the item about the "controversy" concept
FILTER(?controversies != wd:Q1255828)
# require at least one sitelink (article)
FILTER(?sitelinks > 0)
}
ORDER BY DESC(?sitelinks)
query.2445:
SELECT ?item ?itemLabel ?image
("Exemplo de premiacao:" as ?s)
?award_label ?sample_award ?sample_awardLabel
WHERE
{
{
SELECT ?item ?image
(COUNT(DISTINCT ?award) as ?award_count)
(CONCAT("Numero de premiacoes: ", STR( ?award_count )) AS ?award_label )
(SAMPLE(?award) as ?sample_award)
WHERE
{
?item wdt:P31 wd:Q5 .
?item wdt:P39 wd:Q5176750 .
?item wdt:P166 ?award .
?item wdt:P18 ?image .
}
GROUP BY ?item ?itemLabel ?image ?award_label
}
SERVICE wikibase:label { bd:serviceParam wikibase:language "pt-br","pt". } # Helps get the label in your language, if not, then en language
}
ORDER BY DESC(?award_count)
query.2450:
SELECT
?loc ?locLabel ?geoshape ?decade
?dg
(URI(concat(str(?dg),"#P8701")) as ?available_census)
(CONCAT(?locLabel, ": ", GROUP_CONCAT(DISTINCT ?year; separator=", ")) as ?available_censusLabel)
WHERE
{
?dg wdt:P8701 / wdt:P585 ?d .
FILTER( year(?d) > 1959)
BIND( str(YEAR(?d)) as ?year)
BIND( CONCAT(str(FLOOR(YEAR(?d)/10)*10),"s") as ?decade)
?dg wdt:P276 ?loc .
OPTIONAL { ?loc wdt:P3896 ?geoshape }
BIND(URI(concat(str(?dg),"#P8701")) as ?available_census)
SERVICE wikibase:label { bd:serviceParam wikibase:language "[AUTO_LANGUAGE],en". }
}
GROUP BY ?loc ?locLabel ?geoshape ?decade ?dg
ORDER BY DESC(?decade)
query.2454:
select (concat(str(?day), "/", str(?month)) as ?date) (count(distinct ?ps) as ?count)
where {
?MP p:P39 ?ps . ?ps ps:P39 ?term . ?term wdt:P279 wd:Q16707842 .
?ps pq:P2715 ?election .
?ps pq:P580 ?elected .
?election wdt:P31* wd:Q7864918 .
bind(day(?elected) as ?day) . bind(month(?elected) as ?month) .
filter(year(?elected) >= 1880) .
} group by ?day ?month order by desc(?count)
query.2461:
SELECT DISTINCT ?item ?itemLabel (COUNT(DISTINCT ?position_statement) AS ?ministerCount)
WHERE
{
# Essere umano di cittadinanza italiana
?item wdt:P31 wd:Q5.
?item wdt:P27 wd:Q38.
# Non piu vecchio/a di Mattarella
?item wdt:P569 ?birth.
filter (?birth > "1941-07-23"^^xsd:dateTime).
filter (?birth < "1972-01-24"^^xsd:dateTime).
# Non morto/a
MINUS { ?item wdt:P570 ?death. }.
# Ex parlamentari
?item wdt:P39/wdt:P361/wdt:P361 wd:Q1117578.
MINUS { ?item wdt:P39/wdt:P361/wdt:P361 wd:Q1117578 ;
pq:P580 ?start FILTER (?start >= "2018-01-01T00:00:00Z"^^xsd:dateTime) . }
# Ex ministri
?item p:P39 ?position_statement .
?position_statement ps:P39/wdt:P361 wd:Q3687318.
# Ma non ministri recenti
MINUS { ?item p:P39 ?position_recent .
?position_recent ps:P39/wdt:P361 wd:Q3687318.
?position_recent pq:P582 ?position_end
FILTER (?position_end >= "2014-01-01T00:00:00Z"^^xsd:dateTime). }
SERVICE wikibase:label { bd:serviceParam wikibase:language "[AUTO_LANGUAGE],it". }
}
GROUP BY ?item ?itemLabel
query.2464:
SELECT ?state ?stateLabel (COUNT(DISTINCT(?band)) AS ?bandCount)
(GROUP_CONCAT(DISTINCT ?bandLabel; SEPARATOR=", ") AS ?bands)
WHERE {
?band p:P31 ?statement1.
?statement1 (ps:P31/(wdt:P279*)) wd:Q215380. # item is instance of musical group or subclass (ie. rock group)
?band p:P136 ?statement0.
?statement0 (ps:P136/(wdt:P279*)) wd:Q25554481. # band genre is punk music or subclass
?band wdt:P740 ?city. # band formed in city
?city wdt:P131* ?state. # county in admin body (state)
?state wdt:P31 wd:Q35657. # state is instance of US State
SERVICE wikibase:label { bd:serviceParam wikibase:language "en".
?state rdfs:label ?stateLabel.
?band rdfs:label ?bandLabel.}
}
GROUP BY ?state ?stateLabel
ORDER BY DESC(?bandCount)
query.2466:
SELECT ?production ?productionLabel ?actress ?actressLabel (group_concat(?instanceofLabel ;separator=", ") as ?typeofproduction)
WHERE {
?production wdt:P144 wd:Q170583 ; # thing based on Pride & Prejudice
p:P161 [ ps:P161 ?actress; pq:P453 wd:Q2223341 ] . # cast member has character role elizabeth bennet
?production wdt:P31 ?instanceof
SERVICE wikibase:label { bd:serviceParam wikibase:language "[AUTO_LANGUAGE],en".
?instanceof rdfs:label ?instanceofLabel . # i don't know what this bit does except that it's needed
?production rdfs:label ?productionLabel .
?actress rdfs:label ?actressLabel .
}
}
group by ?production ?productionLabel ?actress ?actressLabel
query.2467:
SELECT distinct ?person ?personLabel ?born ?died
(group_concat(distinct ?classname;separator=", ") as ?class) (count(distinct ?mp) as ?descendant_mp_count) WHERE {
?mp p:P39 ?positionStatement .
?positionStatement ps:P39 wd:Q77685926 . # this person is a member of the current parliament
{ ?mp (wdt:P25|wdt:P22)* ?person . } # mp's mother or father, or their mother or father, and so on
filter not exists { ?person wdt:P31 wd:Q5 } . # the ancestor is not "a human"
?person wdt:P31 ?type . ?type rdfs:label ?classname . filter(lang(?classname) = "en") .
OPTIONAL { ?person wdt:P569 ?born } .
OPTIONAL { ?person wdt:P570 ?died } .
SERVICE wikibase:label { bd:serviceParam wikibase:language "en". }
} group by ?person ?personLabel ?born ?died order by ?personLabel
query.2480:
SELECT ?layer ?article ?person ?personLabel ?personDescription ?coord ?pic ?picGrave ?DoD
WHERE {
?person wdt:P119 wd:Q311; #Place of burial
p:P119 [
pq:P965 ?graveplot;
pq:P625 ?coord];
wdt:P570 ?DoD.
OPTIONAL{ ?person wdt:P18 ?pic .} # If we have an illustration
OPTIONAL{ ?person wdt:P1442 ?picGrave .} # If we have a picture of the grave
OPTIONAL {
?article schema:about ?person .
?article schema:inLanguage "fr" .
?article schema:isPartOf <https://fr.wikipedia.org/> .
}
OPTIONAL { ?person wdt:P21 ?group .} # Occupation in Layer
#BIND(year(?DoD) AS ?Deces)
BIND(
IF(?DoD < "1850-01-01T00:00:00Z"^^xsd:dateTime, "1800-1849",
IF(?DoD < "1900-01-01T00:00:00Z"^^xsd:dateTime, "1850-1899",
IF(?DoD < "1950-01-01T00:00:00Z"^^xsd:dateTime, "1900-1949",
IF(?DoD < "2020-01-01T00:00:00Z"^^xsd:dateTime, "1950-2000",
"2000-2022"))))
AS ?layer).
#FILTER (YEAR(?DoD) >= 2000)
SERVICE wikibase:label { bd:serviceParam wikibase:language "fr, en" .}
}
query.2490:
SELECT DISTINCT
?person ?personLabel ?heigth_in_meters
(SAMPLE(?pic) as ?image)
WHERE
{
?person wdt:P106/wdt:P279* wd:Q864503 .
?person wdt:P31 wd:Q5 .
?person wdt:P2048 ?height .
OPTIONAL{?person wdt:P18 ?pic .}
?person p:P2048 ?statement .
?statement psv:P2048 ?valuenode .
?valuenode wikibase:quantityAmount ?value .
?valuenode wikibase:quantityUnit ?unit .
?unit p:P2370/psv:P2370 [ # conversion to SI unit
wikibase:quantityAmount ?conversion;
wikibase:quantityUnit wd:Q11573; # meter
]
BIND((?value * ?conversion) AS ?heigth_in_meters).
SERVICE wikibase:label { bd:serviceParam wikibase:language "[AUTO_LANGUAGE],en". } # Helps get the label in your language, if not, then en language
}
GROUP BY ?person ?personLabel ?heigth_in_meters
ORDER BY DESC(?heigth_in_meters)
query.2498:
SELECT distinct ?planet ?planetLabel ?satellite ?satelliteLabel ?namedLabel ?namedDescription WHERE {
?planet wdt:P31/wdt:P279* wd:Q13205267.
?satellite wdt:P31/wdt:P279* wd:Q2537.
?satellite wdt:P397 ?planet.
?satellite wdt:P138 ?named.
SERVICE wikibase:label { bd:serviceParam wikibase:language "[AUTO_LANGUAGE],en". }
?planet p:P2244/psv:P2244 ?statement.
?statement wikibase:quantityUnit ?unit.
?statement wikibase:quantityAmount ?distance.
?statement wikibase:quantityNormalized/wikibase:quantityAmount ?distanceNormalized. # convert to normalized unit (meter)
BIND (?distanceNormalized / 9460800000000000 AS ?lightyears)
}
ORDER BY ?lightyears

SELECT ?item ?itemLabel ?pic
WHERE
{
?item wdt:P279* wd:Q693464 .
?item wdt:P17 wd:Q212 .
?item wdt:P18 ?pic .
SERVICE wikibase:label { bd:serviceParam wikibase:language "[AUTO_LANGUAGE],en". } # Helps get the label in your language, if not, then en language

?item ?itemLabel
((?sitelinks * ?sitelinks) as ?links_squared)
WHERE
{
?item wdt:P31 wd:Q103632 .
?item wikibase:sitelinks ?sitelinks .

}
ORDER BY
DESC (?sitelinks)
query.2548:
SELECT DISTINCT (?item AS ?QNumber) ?P220 ?LanguageLabel ?P1098 ?Qualifier_P585
WHERE
{
VALUES ?instance_of { wd:Q34770 wd:Q33384 } # Language or dialect
?item wdt:P31 ?instance_of .
OPTIONAL { ?item wdt:P220 ?P220 . } # ISO 639 3 code
?item p:P1098 ?no_of_speakers_statement .
?no_of_speakers_statement wikibase:rank wikibase:PreferredRank . # Has preferred rank
?no_of_speakers_statement pq:P518 wd:Q36870 . # Has the qualifier applies to part = first language
?no_of_speakers_statement ps:P1098 ?P1098 . # No of speakers
OPTIONAL { ?no_of_speakers_statement pq:P585 ?Qualifier_P585 . } # Optional timestamp
SERVICE wikibase:label
{
bd:serviceParam wikibase:language "en" .
?item rdfs:label ?LanguageLabel .
}
}
ORDER BY DESC(?P1098)
query.2561:
SELECT DISTINCT ?item ?itemLabel ?place ?placeLabel ?coords ?img ?layer WHERE {
?item wdt:P31?/wdt:P279* wd:Q2095 .
?item wdt:P138 ?place .
?place wdt:P17 wd:Q145 .
?place wdt:P131 [] .
OPTIONAL {?place wdt:P625 ?coords} .
OPTIONAL {?item wdt:P18 ?img} .
OPTIONAL {?item wdt:P31?/wdt:P279* wd:Q10943 . BIND (wd:Q10943 AS ?type)} .
OPTIONAL {?item wdt:P31?/wdt:P279* wd:Q3314483 . BIND (wd:Q3314483 AS ?type)} .
OPTIONAL {?item wdt:P31?/wdt:P279* wd:Q40050 . BIND (wd:Q40050 AS ?type)} .
OPTIONAL {BIND (wd:Q2095 AS ?type)} .
OPTIONAL {?type rdfs:label ?layer . FILTER(lang(?layer) = 'en')}
SERVICE wikibase:label { bd:serviceParam wikibase:language "[AUTO_LANGUAGE],en". }
} ORDER BY ?itemLabel
query.2569:
SELECT
?item ?itemLabel
(COUNT(DISTINCT ?disease) AS ?n_diseases)
WHERE
{
?item wdt:P31 wd:Q7187 .
?disease wdt:P2293|^wdt:P2293 ?item.
SERVICE wikibase:label { bd:serviceParam wikibase:language "[AUTO_LANGUAGE],en". } # Helps get the label in your language, if not, then en language
}
GROUP BY
?item ?itemLabel
ORDER BY
DESC (?n_diseases)
LIMIT 20
query.2579:
SELECT ?person ?personLabel ?spouse ?spouseLabel ?grandparent ?grandparentLabel ?linkcount WHERE {
?person wdt:P31 wd:Q5 . # en manniska
?person wdt:P26 ?spouse .
?person wdt:P569 ?date .
FILTER(datatype(?date)=xsd:dateTime
&& ?date >= "1800-01-01T00:00:00"^^xsd:dateTime)
?person wikibase:sitelinks ?linkcount .
?spouse wikibase:sitelinks ?spouselinkcount .
FILTER (?linkcount >= ?spouselinkcount) # for att inte fa paren tva ganger (utom nar lika "kanda")
?parent wdt:P40 ?person .
?grandparent wdt:P40 ?parent .
?spouseparent wdt:P40 ?spouse .
?grandparent wdt:P40 ?spouseparent .
?person wikibase:sitelinks ?linkcount . # hur sortera pa t.ex. summa av linkcount?
SERVICE wikibase:label { bd:serviceParam wikibase:language "sv,en,de,fr" }
}
GROUP BY ?linkcount ?person ?personLabel ?spouse ?spouseLabel ?grandparent ?grandparentLabel
ORDER BY DESC(?linkcount)

query.2595:

WHERE
{

wdt:P26 ?person2 .
?person1 p:P39 ?function1Statement .
?function1Statement ps:P39 wd:Q3044918 .
?function1Statement pq:P2937 ?legislature1 .
?person2 wdt:P31 wd:Q5 .
?person2 p:P39 ?function2Statement .

FILTER(?legislature1 = ?legislature2)
FILTER(str(?person1) < str(?person2))
SERVICE wikibase:label { bd:serviceParam wikibase:language "fr,en". }
}
query.2597:
SELECT ?item ?itemLabel ?pic ?birth_date WHERE
{
BIND(MONTH(NOW()) AS ?nowMonth)
BIND(DAY(NOW()) AS ?nowDay)
?item wdt:P106 wd:Q937857 .
?item wdt:P18 ?pic .
?item wikibase:sitelinks ?sitelinks .
hint:Prior hint:rangeSafe true.
FILTER(?sitelinks > 20)
?item wdt:P569 ?birth_date .
hint:Prior hint:rangeSafe true.
FILTER (MONTH(?birth_date) = ?nowMonth && DAY(?birth_date) = ?nowDay)
?item rdfs:label ?itemLabel.
FILTER(LANG(?itemLabel) = "en")
}
ORDER BY
DESC(?sitelinks)

query.2608:
SELECT ?st ?stLabel ?sl ?coords ?line ?layer ?rgb WHERE {
?search (wdt:P31/wdt:P279*) wd:Q5503;wdt:P527 ?lignes.
?lignes wdt:P559 ?termini;(wdt:P31/wdt:P279*) wd:Q107343049.
?st (wdt:P31/wdt:P279*) wd:Q928830;wdt:P16 ?search;wdt:P625 ?coords;(wdt:P81|wdt:P1192) ?sl;wdt:P197 ?pred;p:P197[ps:P197 ?pred;pq:P5051 ?towards;(pq:P81|pq:P1192) ?line_pq].
?pred wdt:P625 ?coords_pred;(wdt:P81|wdt:P1192) ?sl_pred.
FILTER(?sl_pred = ?lignes)FILTER(?sl = ?lignes)FILTER(?towards = ?termini)
?st wdt:P5817 wd:Q55654238.
?pred wdt:P5817 wd:Q55654238.
?lignes wdt:P5817 wd:Q55654238.
?pred p:P625[psv:P625[wikibase:geoLatitude ?lat1;wikibase:geoLongitude ?lon1]; rdf:type wikibase:BestRank].
?st p:P625[psv:P625[wikibase:geoLatitude ?lat2;wikibase:geoLongitude ?lon2]; rdf:type wikibase:BestRank].
BIND(STRDT(CONCAT("LINESTRING(",STR(?lon1)," ",STR(?lat1),",",STR(?lon2)," ",STR(?lat2),")"),geo:wktLiteral)AS ?line)
OPTIONAL{?sl wdt:P465 ?rgb.}
SERVICE wikibase:label{bd:serviceParam wikibase:language "en". ?sl rdfs:label ?layer. ?st rdfs:label ?stLabel}
}
query.2610: SELECT ?q ?qLabel ?loc ?locLabel { ?q wdt:P19 ?loc . ?loc wdt:P31/wdt:P279* wd:Q4022 . SERVICE wikibase:label { bd:serviceParam wikibase:language "[AUTO_LANGUAGE],en". } }
query.2624:
SELECT DISTINCT ?item ?taxonname ?itemLabel ?irudia ?sitelinks WHERE {
?item wdt:P31 wd:Q16521.
?item wdt:P105 wd:Q7432.
?item wdt:P225 ?taxonname.
?item wdt:P171+ wd:Q27720.
?item wdt:P171+ ?family.
?family wdt:P105 wd:Q37517.
?item wdt:P18 ?irudia.
?item wikibase:sitelinks ?sitelinks.
?wen schema:about ?item.
?wen schema:isPartOf <https://ca.wikipedia.org/>.
SERVICE wikibase:label { bd:serviceParam wikibase:language "la,eu". }
FILTER(NOT EXISTS {
?weu schema:about ?item.
?weu schema:inLanguage "eu".
})
}
ORDER BY DESC(?sitelinks)
LIMIT 100
query.2636:
select (STR(?year) as ?year1) (min(?age) as ?age1) where {
wd:Q38111 p:P451 ?s.
?s ps:P451 ?partner .
?s pq:P580 ?from .
?s pq:P582 ?to .
values ?year {1995 1996 1997 1998 1999 2000 2001 2002 2003 2004 2005
2006 2007 2008 2009 2010 2011 2012 2013 2014
2015 2016 2017 2018 2019 2020 2021 2022 }
filter( (YEAR(?from) <= ?year) && (YEAR(?to) >= ?year ) ) .
?partner wdt:P569 ?date_of_birth .
bind((?year - YEAR(?date_of_birth)) as ?age) .
} group by ?year
query.2653:
SELECT DISTINCT ?player ?playerLabel ?sticker_number ?image ?birth_place ?birth_placeLabel ?coord
WHERE
{
wd:Q113646122 p:P180 [
ps:P180 ?player ;
pq:P1545 ?sticker_number
] .
FILTER (!CONTAINS ( ?sticker_number,"FWC"))
?player wdt:P31 wd:Q5 .
?player wdt:P19 ?birth_place .
?birth_place wdt:P625 ?coord .
?birth_place wdt:P17 ?birth_country .
?player wdt:P1532 ?sports_country .
BIND(now() as ?today)
OPTIONAL{?player wdt:P18 ?image}
SERVICE wikibase:label { bd:serviceParam wikibase:language "en". } # Helps get the label in your language, if not, then en language
}
query.2654:
SELECT DISTINCT ?country_for_sports ?country_for_sportsLabel (AVG(?weight) as ?avg_weight) (COUNT(?player) as ?count)
WHERE
{
wd:Q113646122 p:P180 [
ps:P180 ?player ;
pq:P1545 ?sticker_number
] .
FILTER (!CONTAINS ( ?sticker_number,"FWC"))
?player wdt:P31 wd:Q5 .
?player wdt:P1532 ?country_for_sports .
?player p:P2067 ?weight_triples .
?weight_triples ps:P2067 ?weight .
?weight_triples psv:P2067 ?weight_triple_value .
?weight_triple_value wikibase:quantityUnit wd:Q11570 . #only weight in kilos
OPTIONAL{?player wdt:P18 ?image}
SERVICE wikibase:label { bd:serviceParam wikibase:language "en". } # Helps get the label in your language, if not, then en language
}
GROUP BY ?country_for_sports ?country_for_sportsLabel
HAVING (?count > 2)
ORDER BY DESC(?avg_weight)
query.2666:
SELECT DISTINCT ?language ?languageLabel (SUM(?population) as ?sum_pop)
WHERE
{
?item wdt:P37 ?language .
?item wdt:P1082 ?population .
?item wdt:P31 wd:Q3624078 .
?item wdt:P361* wd:Q72829598 .
SERVICE wikibase:label { bd:serviceParam wikibase:language "en". } # Helps get the label in your language, if not, then en language
}
GROUP BY ?language ?languageLabel
query.2669:
SELECT ?item ?title ?wd_coord ?wiki_coord ?dist
WITH
{
SELECT DISTINCT ?item
{
?item wdt:P31 / wdt:P279 * wd:Q55488 .
?item wdt:P17 wd:Q145 .
FILTER STRENDS(STR(?item), "0")
}
} AS %get_items
{
INCLUDE %get_items
?item p:P625 ?s .
?s ps:P625 ?wd_coord .
?s prov:wasDerivedFrom ?ref .
?ref pr:P143 wd:Q328 .
?sitelink schema:about ?item .
?sitelink schema:isPartOf <https://en.wikipedia.org/> .
?sitelink schema:name ?title .
SERVICE wikibase:mwapi
{
bd:serviceParam wikibase:endpoint "en.wikipedia.org" .
bd:serviceParam wikibase:api "Generator" .
bd:serviceParam mwapi:generator "allpages" .
bd:serviceParam mwapi:gapfrom ?title .
bd:serviceParam mwapi:gapto ?title .
bd:serviceParam mwapi:prop "coordinates" .
?lat wikibase:apiOutput "coordinates/co/@lat" .
?lon wikibase:apiOutput "coordinates/co/@lon" .
}
BIND (STRDT(CONCAT("Point(", ?lon, " ", ?lat, ")"), geo:wktLiteral) AS ?wiki_coord)
BIND (geof:distance(?wd_coord, ?wiki_coord) AS ?dist)
FILTER (! BOUND(?dist) || ?dist > 0.0)
} ORDER BY DESC(?dist)
query.2692:
SELECT ?Nationalflagge ?NationalflaggeLabel ?Bild WHERE {
SERVICE wikibase:label { bd:serviceParam wikibase:language "[AUTO_LANGUAGE],de". }
?Nationalflagge wdt:P31 wd:Q186516.
?Nationalflagge wdt:P18 ?Bild.
?Nationalflagge wdt:P462 ?Farbe1.
?Nationalflagge wdt:P462 ?Farbe2.
# ?Farbe2 wdt:P279 wd:Q3257809.
# FILTER (?Farbe1 in (wd:Q3257809)). #Purpur
FILTER (?Farbe1 in (wd:Q23444)). #Weiss
FILTER (?Farbe2 in (wd:Q943)). #Gelb
}
LIMIT 100
query.2708:
SELECT DISTINCT ?p ?pLabel ?pDescription
(GROUP_CONCAT(DISTINCT ?cLabel ; separator="; ") AS ?country)
(GROUP_CONCAT(DISTINCT ?bpLabel ; separator="; ") AS ?birthplace)
(GROUP_CONCAT(DISTINCT YEAR(?bd) ; separator="; ") AS ?born)
(GROUP_CONCAT(DISTINCT YEAR(?dd) ; separator="; ") AS ?died)
?gLabel ?num_statements
WHERE
{ ?p wdt:P31 wd:Q5 ;
wdt:P1344 wd:Q208191 ;
wikibase:statements ?num_statements .
OPTIONAL { ?p wdt:P27 ?c . ?c rdfs:label ?cLabel .
FILTER ( LANG ( ?cLabel ) = "en" ) } .
OPTIONAL { ?p wdt:P19 ?bp . ?bp rdfs:label ?bpLabel .
FILTER ( LANG ( ?bpLabel ) = "en" ) } .
OPTIONAL { ?p wdt:P569 ?bd } .
OPTIONAL { ?p wdt:P570 ?dd } .
OPTIONAL { ?p wdt:P21 ?g } .
SERVICE wikibase:label { bd:serviceParam wikibase:language "[AUTO_LANGUAGE],en" }
}
GROUP BY ?p ?pLabel ?pDescription ?country ?birthplace ?born ?died ?gLabel ?num_statements
ORDER BY DESC(?num_statements)
query.2724:
SELECT DISTINCT ?human ?humanLabel ?mastodon ?url (GROUP_CONCAT(?domain_label;separator=" | ") AS ?domains) WHERE {
?human wdt:P31 wd:Q5 .
?human wdt:P4033 ?mastodon .
?human wdt:P106 wd:Q1650915 .
?human wdt:P101 ?domain .
?domain rdfs:label ?domain_label .
FILTER (LANG(?domain_label) = "en")
BIND(REPLACE(?mastodon, "@.*", "") AS ?userhandle)
BIND(REPLACE(?mastodon, ".*@", "") AS ?host)
BIND(URI(CONCAT("https://", ?host, "/@", ?userhandle)) AS ?url)
SERVICE wikibase:label { bd:serviceParam wikibase:language "[AUTO_LANGUAGE],en". }
}
GROUP BY ?human ?humanLabel ?mastodon ?url
ORDER BY ?domains
query.2742:
SELECT ?ratio (COUNT(?q) AS ?nombre) WHERE {
?q wdt:P31 wd:Q3305213 ; #tableau
wdt:P195 wd:Q3329701 ; #au musee de Bretagne
wdt:P2048 ?hauteur ; #avec une hauteur
wdt:P2049 ?largeur . #avec une largeur
BIND ( STR(?hauteur/?largeur) AS ?ratio ) #ratio de la hauteur et de la largeur
}
GROUP BY ?ratio
query.2751:
SELECT DISTINCT ?butir ?nama ?koord ?lat ?lon
WHERE
{
hint:Query hint:optimizer "None" .
?butir wdt:P17* wd:Q833 .
?butir wdt:P31/wdt:P279* wd:Q33506 .
?butir wdt:P625 ?koord .
?butir p:P625 ?coordinate .
?coordinate psv:P625 ?coordinate_node .
?coordinate_node wikibase:geoLatitude ?lat .
?coordinate_node wikibase:geoLongitude ?lon .
SERVICE wikibase:label {
bd:serviceParam wikibase:language "ms" .
?butir rdfs:label ?nama
}
}
ORDER BY ASC (?nama)

description.521:
All properties whose values are items and which lack a type constraint and property scope constraint.
Some of these may be actually general properties, while others just don't have their relevant type constraint defined yet.
The lack of property scope constraint just identifies high priority ones, as that constraint is always required, so
if it is missing, it makes it more likely that there is a reasonable type constraint that just hasn't been defined.
description.522:
See also the SPARQL manual
//en.wikibooks.org/wiki/SPARQL/WIKIDATA_Qualifiers,_References_and_Ranks
In this example we look for statements which assign a specific value (Q51955019)
to the property P1343 and then look for references of that property, specifically
the string associated to P958 for the reference. May actually bring up references
for other P1343 statements; uses the shortened expression syntax with brackets.

context.381:
nodes in WDQS
RDF nodes in {{Q|Q32786132}} follow specific naming conventions.
*  wd:  - ''entity'', browsable in {{Q|Q16354758}} or scriptable in {{Q|Q21679293}}
*  wds:  - ''statement node'', internal part
*  wdref:  - ''reference node'', internal part
*  wdv:  - ''value node'', internal part
* [unprefixed] - ''sitelink node'', per every language, per every project
context.382:
nodes in WDQS
RDF nodes in {{Q|Q32786132}} follow specific naming conventions.
*  wd:  - ''entity'', browsable in {{Q|Q16354758}} or scriptable in {{Q|Q21679293}}
*  wds:  - ''statement node'', internal part
*  wdref:  - ''reference node'', internal part
*  wdv:  - ''value node'', internal part
* [unprefixed] - ''sitelink node'', per every language, per every project
 
Entities
Entities that represent properties
''{{Q|Q18616576}}''
It is possible to use ''entities'' for properties (they have information about  wikibase:directClaim ).
It is impossible to substitute property path at second position with property at second position in one triple [as opposed to {{label|Q31209160}} and {{label|Q31209194}}]. But it is possible with more triples or other variable-forming constructs. One nuance is to use entity outside triple where resulting property should be applied.
 
 Examples

Property in Wikidata model is augmented with [[Help:Ranks]] and can be used in multiple positions (references, qualifiers).
Most ''[[Special:ListDatatypes|Wikibase types]]'' have ''simple values''. https://www.mediawiki.org/wiki/Wikibase/Indexing/RDF_Dump_Format#Value_representation 
By simple values we mean anything from [[#RDF_node_.28Q31465098.29|RDF node]] section [IRIs, xsd:string, language-tagged literals, literals with other types, blank nodes].
Simple values can be accessed with following prefixes, depending on where property was used:
* from Entity -  wdt:  [historic and wrong values aren't accessible here, see table on the right]
* from Statement node to value of property -  ps: 
* from Statement node to value of qualifier -  pq: 
* from Reference node -  pr:

''Relative clauses. Properties of the object.''
Suppose we're not actually interested in Bach's children, but in his ''grand''children.
For this task we would use {{P|40}}, which points from parent to child and is gender-independent. Possible solution below:
Brackets syntax
Note that we don't need information about the child (?child): we don't use the variable except to talk about the '''grandchild'''.
We can refer back to them because we've said "someone ''who''": this starts a relative clause, and within that relative clause we can say things about "someone" (e. g., that he or she "has a child ?grandChild").
In SPARQL we can use a pair of brackets ( [] ) in the left or right part, which acts as an anonymous variable.
Inside the brackets, we can specify predicate-object pairs, just like after a  ;  after a normal triple; the implicit subject is in this case the anonymous variable that the brackets represent. (Note: also just like after a  ; , we can add more predicate-object pairs with more semicolons, or more objects for the same predicate with commas.)

SPARQL punctuation
Property paths
Property paths are a way to very tersely write down a ''path of properties between two items''. ''Sequence path'' elements are separated with a forward slash ( / ):
 
 Examples without endless paths 
 
{|  
|-
! SPARQL !! Items and properties !! Description
|-
|  ?river wdt:P403 wd:Q1497  || {{P|403}}, {{Q|Q1497}} || All ''items'' that flow '''directly''' into the Mississippi River
|-
|  wd:Q1339 wdt:P40 ?descendant  || {{P|P40}}, {{Q|Q1339}} || Children of {{Q|Q1339}}
|-
|  wd:Q1339 wdt:P40 ?child. ?child wdt:P40 ?descendant  || {{P|P40}}, {{Q|Q1339}} || Grandchildren of {{Q|Q1339}}
|-
|  wd:Q1339 wdt:P40 [ wdt:P40 ?descendant ]  || {{P|P40}}, {{Q|Q1339}} || Grandchildren of {{Q|Q1339}}
|-
|  wd:Q1339 wdt:P40/wdt:P40 ?descendant  || {{P|P40}}, {{Q|Q1339}} || Grandchildren of {{Q|Q1339}}
|-
! colspan=3 | 9 Property Paths https://www.w3.org/TR/2013/REC-sparql11-query-20130321/#pp-language 
|}
 
 
 
Repeated and endless paths could be expressed using  + ; same but optional - using  * .
 |  can be used to provide alternatives.
 
 Examples with endless paths 
 
{|  
|-
! SPARQL !! Items and properties !! Description
|-
|  ?river wdt:P403+ wd:Q1497  || {{P|403}}, {{Q|Q1497}} || All ''items'' that flow into the Mississippi River, '''directly or indirectly'''
|-
|  wd:Q1339 wdt:P40+ ?descendant  || {{P|P40}}, {{Q|Q1339}} || All ''descendants'' of {{Q|Q1339}}
|-
|  wd:Q1339 wdt:P40* ?descendant  || {{P|P40}}, {{Q|Q1339}} || All ''descendants'' of {{Q|Q1339}}, '''including''' {{Q|Q1339}}
|-
|  ?descendant (wdt:P22|wdt:P25)+ wd:Q1339  || {{P|P22}}, {{P|P25}}, {{Q|Q1339}} || All ''descendants'' of {{Q|Q1339}}
|-
|  ?work wdt:P31/wdt:P279* wd:Q838948  || {{P|P31}}, {{P|P279}}, {{Q|Q838948}} || Instance of any {{label|Property:P279}} {{Q|Q838948}}
|-
|  ?instance wdt:P31/wdt:P279* ?class  || {{P|P31}}, {{P|P279}}, {{Q|Q28326490}}, {{Q|Q28326484}}, || Instance of any {{label|Property:P279}} class
|-
! colspan=3 | 9 Property Paths https://www.w3.org/TR/2013/REC-sparql11-query-20130321/#pp-language 
|}
 
 
 
 
 Example: list of suitable properties for given item

 Example: list of suitable properties for given item 
 
Symmetric properties and self-references
In Wikidata properties can [[Special:ListProperties/wikibase-item|refer to other elements]]. Sometimes items are obligated to have links between each other: [https://www.wikidata.org/w/index.php?title=Special%3AWhatLinksHere&target=Template%3AConstraint%3ASymmetric&namespace=121 symmetric property].
In practice this means that you might encounter:
* Stations in 2 hops from {{Q|801551}}:  wd:Q801551 wdt:P197/wdt:P197 ?i2  will return references back to {{Q|801551}}
Possible solution is to append  FILTER (?item != wd:Q801551)  after triple in Group Graph Patterns.
 
 Detailed explanation with Mona Lisa 
 
[[File:Rdf mapping.svg|right|frame|400x400px|RDF mappings (above) are different from what we use in SPARQL; Image is used to illustrate idea of additional nodes and links between them]]
{{Q'|Q12418}} and {{P'|186}}:
# {{Q|296955}}, the main material;
# {{Q|291034}}, with the qualifier {{St||518|861259}} - this is the material that the Mona Lisa was painted ''on''
Suppose we want to find all paintings with their painting surface, that is, those {{P|186}} statements with a qualifier {{St||518|861259}}. How do we do that? That's more information than can be represented in a single triple.
The answer is: more triples!
{{#tag:syntaxhighlight|
#extracted from https://www.wikidata.org/wiki/Special:EntityData/Q12418.ttl
wd:Q12418 p:P186 wds:q12418-B76F63CF-7E3D-435F-8694-7F743F494B71 .
wds:q12418-B76F63CF-7E3D-435F-8694-7F743F494B71 rdf:type wikibase:Statement, wikibase:BestRank ;
wikibase:rank wikibase:PreferredRank ;
ps:P186 wd:Q296955 .
wd:Q12418 p:P186 wds:Q12418-053f412b-4541-92f8-ebba-f73c568f5c9b .
wds:Q12418-053f412b-4541-92f8-ebba-f73c568f5c9b rdf:type wikibase:Statement, wikibase:BestRank ;
wikibase:rank wikibase:PreferredRank ;
ps:P186 wd:Q291034 ;
pq:P518 wd:Q861259 .
|lang=SPARQL
}}
Wikidata's solution for almost everything is more resources: references, numeric precision, values with units, geocoordinates, etc...

:  wd: 
; direct property
:  wdt:  - best values; it respects ranks: ''only preferred'' values, else ''only normal'' and never deprecated
; statement node
:  p:  - link between entity (item) and statement ( wds: ); it selects every statement node, regardless of ranks or other information. This node then is the subject of other prefixes below;
:; property statements
::  ps:  - " to statement object using statement nodes
:; property qualifier
::  pq:  - " to statement qualifiers using statement nodes
:; ranks
::  wikibase:rank  - " to rank
:; references 
::  prov:wasDerivedFrom  - " to reference nodes
{{clear}}
Here's a concrete example for the Mona Lisa:
{{#tag:syntaxhighlight|
wd:Q12418 p:P186 ?st1. # Mona Lisa: material used: ?st1 # p: is a link between entity and a statement
?st1 ps:P186 wd:Q296955. # value: oil paint # ps: is a link between statement and values
wd:Q12418 p:P186 ?st2. # Mona Lisa: material used: ?st2
?st2 ps:P186 wd:Q291034. # value: poplar wood
?st2 pq:P518 wd:Q861259. # qualifier: applies to part: painting surface # pq: is a link between statement and qualifiers
|lang=SPARQL
}}
 
 We can abbreviate first group using property paths 
 
{{#tag:syntaxhighlight|
wd:Q12418 p:P186/ps:P186 wd:Q296966.
|lang=SPARQL}}
 
 
 
 
 We can abbreviate both groups with the ''brackets syntax'' 
 
{{#tag:syntaxhighlight|
wd:Q12418 p:P186 [ ps:P186 wd:Q296966 ].
wd:Q12418 p:P186 [
ps:P186 wd:Q291034;
pq:P518 wd:Q861259
].
|lang=SPARQL}}
 
 
 
'''Exercise''': a query for all paintings with their painting surface?
 
 Possible solution
context.394:
Retrieving items with optional information ( OPTIONAL )
''{{Q|Q31341045}}''
A president can have a spouse, but this is optional. More generally, in Wikidata an entity can miss properties (as opposed to explicit "no value" statements).
Let's try to query books by {{Q|Q35610}} that also includes fthe {{P|1476}}, {{P|110}}, {{P|123}} and {{P|577}}:
It only returns two results, why is that?
 
 Explanation 
 
Reason is very simple: 5 patterns are glued using "and" conjunctions.
Fragment of previous query using simple syntax:
 ?book wdt:P50 wd:Q35610 . # required wdt:P50
?book wdt:P1476 ?title . # required wdt:P1476
?book wdt:P110 ?illustrator. # required wdt:P110
?book wdt:P123 ?publisher . # required wdt:P123
?book wdt:P577 ?published # required wdt:P577 
In other words, to match this query, a potential '''result must match all the triples we listed''': it must have a title, and an illustrator, and a publisher, and a publication date. '''If it has some of those properties, but not all of them, it won't match'''.
 
 
 
That's not what we want: we primarily want a list of all the books - if additional data is available, we'd like to include it, but we don't want that to limit our list of results.
The solution is to tell SPARQL executor that those properties are ''optional'':
* wrap '''each group graph pattern''' with optional clause when desired, line before:  ?book wdt:P1476 ?title.  and after:  OPTIONAL { ?book wdt:P1476 ?title } 
* optionals can be (and should be) nested for every part of graph where data could be missing (optional)
* order matters, place "OPTIONAL" after required patterns https://wiki.blazegraph.com/wiki/index.php/SPARQL_Order_Matters 
* place it '''after'''  VALUES 
 
 Note: it's very important to use separate  OPTIONAL  clauses here 
 
If you put all the triples into a single clause, like here:
- you'll notice that most of the results don't include any extra information. Same principle applies to ''Group Graph Patterns'' within "OPTIONAL" clause: all 4 patterns must be satisfied.
 
 
 
 Note: OPTIONAL and VALUES 
 
 
 
 
 Example with nested optionals: US presidents and spouses 
 
 
 
 
 
 Note: property paths are always "required" and never "optional"

context.400:
Instances and classes
{{see also|Help:Basic membership properties|User:TomT0m/Classification}}
Earlier, we noted that most Wikidata properties are "has" relations: ''has'' child, ''has'' father, ''has'' occupation. But sometimes (in fact, frequently), you also need to talk about what something ''is'':
* {{Claim|Q2875|31|Q11424}}
* {{Claim|Q11424|279|Q838948}}
When we want to search for "all {{label|Q838948}}", it's not enough search for all items that are ''direct instances'' of {{label|Q838948}}:
That query only returns 2815 results - obviously, there are over 868119 {{label|Q838948}}! The problem is that this misses items like ''{{label|Q2875}}'', which is only an {{label|Property:P31}} {{label|Q11424}}, not of {{label|Q838948}}. We need to tell SPARQL to account following claim when searching:
{{C|Q11424|279|Q838948}}
One possible solution to this is the ''brackets syntax'' we talked about: ''{{label|Q2875}}'' is an {{label|Property:P31}} '''some class''' {{label|Property:P279}} "{{label|Q838948}}".
But this might be not what you want:
# We're no longer including items that are directly instances of {{label|Q838948}}. In other words, {{label|Property:P279}} relations in path can be optional.
# We're still missing items that are instances of some {{label|Property:P279}} some ''other'' {{label|Property:P279}} "{{label|Q838948}}" - for example, ''Snow White and the Seven Dwarfs'' is an animated film, which is a film, which is a {{label|Q838948}}. In this case, we need to follow two "{{label|Property:P279}}" statements - but it might also be three, four, five, any number really.
# For some properties, degree of nesting isn't known beforehand: not only it means that there might be a deep chain of {{label|Property:P279}} but also such chain should be ''combined'' (wasn't covered yet) with short chains of few {{label|Property:P279}}. The more links, the more nesting, the less query is readable by humans. Furthermore query that uses ''simplest syntax'' or ''brackets syntax'' won't match layers of underlying data exactly (3 levels in query, but 4 in data) and every time you change the data, you have to update query as well in order to match them back.
More complex, but also more flexible solution:

context.402:
Unknown or no values
{{see also|Help:Statements#Unknown or no values}}
''{{Q|Q19798647}}. {{Q|Q19798648}}.''
This is rarely used.
* empty cell in WDQS; "no value" https://www.mediawiki.org/wiki/Wikibase/Indexing/RDF_Dump_Format#Novalue  is stored as  rdf:type  https://www.w3.org/TR/2014/REC-rdf-schema-20140225/#ch_type  of ''statement node''
* ''t58922719'' or similar instead of value; "unknown value" https://www.mediawiki.org/wiki/Wikibase/Indexing/RDF_Dump_Format#Somevalue  is a ''blank node'' https://www.w3.org/TR/2014/NOTE-rdf11-primer-20140624/#h3_section-blank-node  https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Blank_node ,  isBlank()  https://www.w3.org/TR/2013/REC-sparql11-query-20130321/#func-isBlank  is used in SPAQRL to detect these
When properties are:
* known beforehand: solution involves checks  IF(boolean condition, then, else)  where conditions are as described above
* unknown beforehand: solution is more complex
 
 Checks for P577 "values" "unknown value" and "no value" for every value/property/item

context.404:
Pagination ( ORDER  and  LIMIT )
It's quite common to care only about a few results: a first, first to, pioneer in; oldest, earliest; youngest, latest.
In order to get an answer our entities should be ordered and limited:
;  ORDER BY something  sorts the results by  something .
:  something  can be any expression - for now, the only kind of expression we know are simple variables ( ?something ), but we'll see some other kinds later. This expression can also be wrapped in either  ASC()  or  DESC()  to specify the sorting order ('''asc'''ending or '''desc'''ending). (If you don't specify either, the default is ascending sort, so  ASC(something)  is equivalent to just  something .)
;  LIMIT count  cuts off the result list at  count  results,
: where  count  is any natural number. For example,  LIMIT 10  limits the query to ten results.  LIMIT 1  only returns a single result.
(You can also use  LIMIT  without  ORDER BY . In this case, the results aren't sorted, so you don't have any guarantee which results you'll get. Which is fine if you happen to know that there's only a certain number of results, or you're just interested in ''some'' result, but don't care about which one. In either case, adding the  LIMIT  can significantly speed up the query, since WDQS can stop searching for results as soon as it's found enough to fill the limit.)
The query that returns the ten most populous countries:

context.441:
Understanding SPARQL
US presidents and their spouses
It is all very well to be able to look up all the statements that can be related to a particular string, but more usually we would like to be able to ask questions relating to specific items and properties.
Next, then, here is a query involving some actual Wikidata properties and items. The following is a query to return a list of married U.S. presidents and their spouses:
context.442:
Understanding SPARQL
US presidents and their spouses, in date order
What if we want to put the presidents into date order? The simply "truthy" representation of properties like {{P|39}} does not give access to qualifiers like {{P|580}}.
Instead, the query can be achieved as follows, by using connectors which live in three further namespaces:
*  p:  - which contains representations of properties such as  p:P39 , that link an item (or, more technically, an entity) to a statement;
*  ps:  - which contains representations of properties such as  ps:P39 , that link a statement to a value; and
*  pq:  - which contains representations, such as  pq:P580 , of properties being used as qualifiers, that connect a statement to a qualifier value.
context.443:
Optionality and alternatives
Excluding subsets
SPARQL has three different idioms for excluding subsets:
*  OPTIONAL { ... ?x ... } FILTER(!bound(?x))  ,
*  FILTER NOT EXISTS { ... } 
*  MINUS { ... } 
Currently, in [https://www.w3.org/TR/sparql11-query/#neg-notexists-minus almost all circumstances], Blazegraph resolves all of these to the same query plan.
context.444:
Querying a class tree
Properties registered as {{P|1963}} for a class or its super-classes
This query is templated with template {{tl|PropertyForThisType}}, for example   {{PropertyForThisType|Q875538}}   for the class {{Q|875538}}. It finds properties marked using P1963 as being relevant to the class, either for the class itself, or for one of the super-classes in its tree.

context.483:
Simple queries 
   Humans born in New York City 
 
 
This example highlights the correct way to use the {{P|19}} property, and by extension the {{P|20}} property.
{{P|19}} is the most specific known place of birth. For example, it is known that Donald Trump ({{Q|22686}}) was born in the Jamaica Hospital ({{Q|23497866}}) in New York City. Therefore, he wouldn't show up in direct query for humans born in New York City.

   Metabolite-metabolite interactions (mostly conversions) and their pKa change (federated query) 
Federated query using the WikiPathways SPARQL endpoint to retrieve interaction information.
The dimensions plot show the pKa changes during metabolite-metabolite interaction. It must
be noted here that many very basic or very acidic are reported in pathways as the uncharged
structure, whereas in normal biological pathways these compounds are charged and then have
quite different pKa charges.

context.716:
Our first query
Suppose we want to list all children of the baroque composer Johann Sebastian Bach. Using pseudo-elements like in the queries above, how would you write that query?
Hopefully you got something like this:
{{#tag:syntaxhighlight|
SELECT ?child
WHERE
{
# child "has parent" Bach
?child parent Bach.
# (note: everything after a '#' is a comment and ignored by WDQS.)
}
|lang=SPARQL
}}
or this,
{{#tag:syntaxhighlight|
SELECT ?child
WHERE
{
# child "has father" Bach
?child father Bach.
}
|lang=SPARQL
}}
or this,
{{#tag:syntaxhighlight|
SELECT ?child
WHERE
{
# Bach "has child" child
Bach child ?child.
}
|lang=SPARQL
}}
The first two triples say that the  ?child  must have the parent/father Bach; the third says that Bach must have the child  ?child . Let's go with the second one for now.
So what remains to be done in order to turn this into a proper WDQS query? On Wikidata, items and properties are not identified by human-readable names like "father" (property) or "Bach" (item). (For good reason: "Johann Sebastian Bach" is also the name of a [[Q638391|German painter]], and "Bach" might also refer to the [[Q1409748|surname]], the [[Q936005|French commune]], the [[Q1072625|Mercury crater]], etc.) Instead, Wikidata items and properties are assigned an identifier. To find the identifier for an item, we [[Special:Search|search]] for the item and copy the Q-number of the result that sounds like it's the item we're looking for (based on the description, for example). To find the identifier for a property, we do the same, but search for "P:search term" instead of just "search term", which limits the search to properties. This tells us that the famous composer Johann Sebastian Bach is [[Q1339]], and the property to designate an item's father is [[P:P22]].
And last but not least, we need to include prefixes. For simple WDQS triples, items should be prefixed with  wd: , and properties with  wdt: . (But this only applies to fixed values - variables don't get a prefix!)
Putting this together, we arrive at our first proper WDQS query:
Click that "Try it" link, then "Run" the query on the WDQS page. What do you get?
{| 
! child
|-
|[https://www.wikidata.org/entity/Q57225 wd:Q57225]
|-
|[https://www.wikidata.org/entity/Q76428 wd:Q76428]
|-
|...
|}
Well that's disappointing. You just see the identifiers. You can click on them to see their Wikidata page (including a human-readable label), but isn't there a better way to see the results?
Well, as it happens, there is! (Aren't rhetorical questions great?) If you include the magic text
{{#tag:syntaxhighlight|
SERVICE wikibase:label { bd:serviceParam wikibase:language "[AUTO_LANGUAGE]". }
|lang=SPARQL
}}
somewhere within the  WHERE  clause, you get additional variables: For every variable  ?foo  in your query, you now also have a variable  ?fooLabel , which contains the label of the item behind  ?foo . If you add this to the  SELECT  clause, you get the item as well as its label:

context.718:
Advanced triple patterns
So now we've seen all children of Johann Sebastian Bach - more specifically: all items with the father Johann Sebastian Bach. But Bach had two wives, and so those items have two different mothers: what if we '''only want to see the children of Johann Sebastian Bach with his first wife''', Maria Barbara Bach ([[Q57487]])? Try writing that query, based on the one above.
Done that? Okay, then onto the solution! The simplest way to do this is to add a second triple with that restriction:
In English, this reads:
 Child has father Johann Sebastian Bach.
Child has mother Maria Barbara Bach.
 
That sounds a bit awkward, doesn't it? In natural language, we'd abbreviate this:
 Child has father Johann Sebastian Bach and mother Maria Barbara Bach.
 
In fact, it's possible to express the same abbreviation in SPARQL as well: '''if you end a triple with a semicolon ( ; ) instead of a period, you can add another predicate-object pair'''. This allows us to abbreviate the above query to:
which has the same results, but less repetition in the query.
Now suppose that, out of those results, we're interested only in those children who were also composers and pianists. The relevant properties and items are {{P|106}}, {{Q|36834}} and {{Q|486748}}. Try updating the above query to add these restrictions!
Here's my solution:
This uses the  ;  abbreviation two more times to add the two required occupations. But as you might notice, there's still some repetition. This is as if we said:
 Child has occupation composer and occupation pianist.
 
which we would usually abbreviate as:
 Child has occupation composer and pianist.
 
And SPARQL has some syntax for that as well: just like a  ;  allows you to append a predicate-object pair to a triple (reusing the subject), '''a  ,  allows you to append another object to a triple (reusing both subject and predicate)'''. With this, the query can be abbreviated to:
Note: indentation and other whitespaces don't actually matter - they just make it more readable. You can also write this as:
or, rather less readable:
Luckily, the WDQS editor indents lines for you automatically, so you usually don't have to worry about this.
Alright, let's summarize here. We've seen that queries are structured like text. Each triple about a subject is terminated by a period. Multiple predicates about the same subject are separated by semicolons, and multiple objects for the same subject and predicate can be listed separated by commas.
{{#tag:syntaxhighlight|
SELECT ?s1 ?s2 ?s3
WHERE
{
?s1 p1 o1;
p2 o2;
p3 o31, o32, o33.
?s2 p4 o41, o42.
?s3 p5 o5;
p6 o6.
}
|lang=SPARQL
}}
Now I want to introduce one more abbreviation that SPARQL offers. So if you'll humor me for one more hypothetical scenario...
Suppose we're not actually interested in Bach's children. (Who knows, perhaps that's actually true for you!) But we are interested in his ''grand''children. (Hypothetically.) There's one complication here: a grandchild may be related to Bach via the mother or the father. That's two different properties, which is inconvenient. Instead, let's flip the relation around: Wikidata also has a "child" property, [[P:P40]], which points from parent to child and is gender-independent. With this information, can you write a query that returns Bach's grandchildren?
Here's my solution:
In natural language, this reads:
 Bach has a child  ?child .
 ?child  has a child  ?grandChild .
 
Once more, I propose that we abbreviate this English sentence, and then I want to show you how SPARQL supports a similar abbreviation. Observe how we actually don't care about the child: we don't use the variable except to talk about the grandchild. We could therefore abbreviate the sentence to:
 Bach has as child someone who has a child  ?grandChild .
 
Instead of saying who Bach's child is, we just say "someone": we don't care who it is. But we can refer back to them because we've said "someone ''who''": this starts a relative clause, and within that relative clause we can say things about "someone" (e.g., that they "have a child  ?grandChild "). In a way, "someone" is a variable, but a special one that's only valid within this relative clause, and one that we don't explicitly refer to (we say "someone who is this and does that", not "someone who is this and someone who does that" - that's two different "someone"s).
In SPARQL, this can be written as:

context.726:
Instances and classes
Earlier, I said that most Wikidata properties are "has" relations: ''has'' child, ''has'' father, ''has'' occupation. But sometimes (in fact, frequently), you also need to talk about what something ''is''. But there are in fact two kinds of relations there:
* ''Gone with the Wind'' '''is''' a film.
* A film '''is''' a work of art.
''Gone with the Wind'' is one particular film. It has a particular director (Victor Fleming), a specific duration (238 minutes), a list of cast members (Clark Gable, Vivien Leigh, ...), and so on.
''Film'' is a general concept. Films can have directors, durations, and cast members, but the concept "film" as such does not have any particular director, duration, or cast members. And although a film '''is''' a work of art, and a work of art usually has a creator, the concept of "film" itself does not have a creator - only particular ''instances'' of this concept do.
This difference is why there are two properties for "is" in Wikidata: {{P|31}} and {{P|279}}. ''Gone with the Wind'' is a particular instance of the class "film"; the class "film" is a subclass (more specific class; specialization) of the more general class "work of art".
To help you to figure about the difference, you can try to use two different verbs: "is a" and "is a kind of". If "is a kind of" works (e.g. A film "is a kind of" work of art), it indicates that you are talking about a subclass, a specialization of a broader class and you should use {{P|279}}. If "is a kind of" does not work (e.g. the sentence ''Gone with the wind "is a kind of" film'' does not make sense), it indicates that you are talking about a particular instance and you should use {{P|31}}.
So what does this mean for us when we're writing SPARQL queries? When we want to search for "all works of art", it's not enough to search for all items that are directly instances of "work of art":
As I'm writing this (October 2016), that query only returns 2,815 results - obviously, there are more works of art than that! The problem is that this misses items like ''Gone with the Wind'', which is only an instance of "film", not of "work of art". "film" is a subclass of "work of art", but we need to tell SPARQL to take that into account when searching.
One possible solution to this is the  []  syntax we talked about: ''Gone with the Wind'' is an instance of '''some''' subclass of "work of art". (For exercise, try writing that query!) But that still has problems:
# We're no longer including items that are directly instances of work of art.
# We're still missing items that are instances of some subclass of some ''other'' subclass of "work of art" - for example, ''Snow White and the Seven Dwarfs'' is an animated film, which is a film, which is a work of art. In this case, we need to follow two "subclass of" statements - but it might also be three, four, five, any number really.
The solution:  ?item wdt:P31/wdt:P279* ?class . This means that there's one "instance of" and then any number of "subclass of" statements between the item and the class.
